wikipedia_page.main: Alfred William Frankland MBE (19 March 1912 – 2 April 2020) was a British allergist and immunologist whose achievements included the popularisation of the pollen count as a piece of weather-related information to the British public, speculation regarding the effects of overly sterile living environments, and the prediction of increased levels of allergy to penicillin. He continued to work for a number of years after turning 100.

response: * William Frankland,  — allergist.From Hell Island To Hay Fever: The Life of Dr Bill Frankland, Paul Watkins, Brown Dog Books, 2018

** William Frankland, British medical researcher, noted for his research on allergies to penicillin and pollen, in Battle, East Sussex, England (d. 2020)
